value.title: First Look: Delta, TSA Launch Facial Recognition At Atlanta Airport
value.excerpt: The next step in airport automation has become a reality, just in time for the holidays. Delta Airlines, the Transportation Security Administration (TSA), and a travel tech company called Pangiam have partnered up to bring facial recognition technology to the Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL).

value.title: How Humans-In-The-Loop AI Can Help Solve The Data Problem
value.excerpt: Humans-in-the-loop AI is a niche wherein AI and ML systems are built with human interference at different stages of the cycle, whenever it’s necessary.

value.title: Top Indian Robotics Start-ups that have Gained Funding in 2021
value.excerpt: India has been evolving as the biggest start-ups ecosystem. In which robotics start-ups have a great visible space. Let’s know more about the Indian robotics start-ups funding in 2021 in this article.

value.title: Dubai to soon have regulation to pave way for driverless cars on roads
value.excerpt: Dubai: Dubai expects in 2022 to complete the regulation needed to allow self-driving cars on the roads by 2023, a senior official said on Wednesday. Ahmed Hashim Bahrozyan, CEO of the Public Transport Agency of Dubai’s Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) told reporters: “We are quite fast compared to other cities in issuing the regulation [to govern self-driving cars on the roads].

value.title: Google Tensor gets crushed by Apple A15 in machine learning despite being a ML-centric chip
value.excerpt: The Google Tensor processor is supposed be all about machine learning but it got crushed by the Apple A15 Bionic in the Geekbench ML app.

value.title: Computer vision platform Cogniac nabs $20M to bolster its customer acquisition efforts
value.excerpt: Cogniac, a startup developing computer vision technology primarily for industrial and manufacturing companies, raised $20 million in capital.

value.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 3070 vs. AMD Radeon RX 6800: Which GPU should you buy?

value.title: Microsoft powers transformation at NVIDIA GTC Fall—GPU technology conference

value.title: Infrastructure and data issues hamper companies adopting AI, study finds
value.excerpt: More than three-quarters of companies say that they have AI models that never come into use. For 20% of companies, the numbers look even worse, with only 10% of their models making it into production.

value.title: NTSB head criticizes Tesla's self-driving features, calls them 'misleading'
value.excerpt: NTSB Chairwoman Jennifer Homendy called the company's use of "Full Self-Driving" for its latest driver-assist systems "misleading."

value.title: New VMware CTO Kit Colbert Steers The Company Towards SaaS
value.excerpt: Ranked Industry Analyst Patrick Moorhead dives in as there is a new Chief Technology Officer at VMware. Kit Colbert is thirty days into the role after eighteen years at VMware, where he started as an intern.
